alert.note: Alert for Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 6:36PM EDT until July 25 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL MONROE COUNTY... At 636 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated earlier thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen since late this afternoon across portions of Rochester. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rochester, Greece, Irondequoit, East Rochester, Brighton, Gates-North Gates, Penfield and Rochester General Hospital. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
